queue.name: Setup Wizard Skipped After Account Creation
queue.description: BLOCKER. After creating a new account, the Setup wizard (/setup) is skipped — user goes straight to /dashboard. Root cause: race condition in App.jsx. setupComplete state initialized to true (line 26), and the useEffect that reads user.setup_completed (lines 34-37) runs AFTER the first render. So the redirect check at lines 116-122 sees setupComplete=true on the initial render and either doesn't redirect to /setup or actively redirects away from it. The backend correctly returns setup_completed:false for new users (models/__init__.py:70, services/auth.py:479).
change: frontend/src/App.jsx line 26: Change setupComplete initial state from true to null (unknown). This represents 'not yet determined' state.

frontend/src/App.jsx lines 116-122: Update redirect logic to treat setupComplete===null as 'still loading, don't redirect yet'. Only redirect to /setup when setupComplete===false. Only redirect away from /setup when setupComplete===true.
ALSO: SSH into VPS and clear the database so the user can test full signup → setup flow. Find hubllm.db location, delete it, restart backend so init_db() recreates empty tables.
queue.test: Delete DB, restart backend. Go to hubllm.dev, create new account. Should land on /setup wizard, NOT /dashboard. Complete setup, confirm redirect to /dashboard. Refresh page — should stay on /dashboard, not loop back to /setup.
queue.completion_note: Fixed race condition: setupComplete init changed from true to null, added loading gate before redirect logic. DB reset is a manual testing step for the user.
